Package gov.sandia.geotess.extensions.siteterms

Class SiteData

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.geotess.extensions.siteterms.SiteData
  • public class SiteData
extends java.lang.Object
    Container class for site terms. Presumably by tomographic inversion. These objects don't have a reference to a station name because it is presumed that they will be the values in a Map<String, ArrayList<SiteTerm>> where the keys are the station names and the values are the list of station locations at different on/off times.

      protected Data data
      site term in seconds.

      protected double[] stationLocation
      The location of the station to which the site term is applicable.
      protected double stationRadius
      The radius of the station to which the site term is applicable.

      • SiteData

        public SiteData​(java.io.DataInputStream input,
                gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.vector.EarthShape earthShape,
                AttributeDataDefinitions attrDef,
                int formatVersion)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor that reads a site term from a DataInputStream.
        Parameters:
        input - The DataInputStream from which the site terms is read.
        earthShape - The EarthShape for the site defining this site term.
        attrDef - The data definition for the site terms to be stored on this SiteData object.
        formatVersion - if == 1 then double onTime, offTime are read from the input, otherwise, integer onDate, offDate are read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getOnDate

        public long getOnDate()
        Turn on date. Date on which the station, or sensor indicated began operating. The columns offdate and ondate are not intended to accommodate temporary downtimes, but rather to indicate the time period for which the columns of the station (<I>lat</I>, <I>lon</I>, <I>elev</I>,) are valid for the given station code. Stations are often moved, but with the station code remaining unchanged.
        Returns:
        ondate

      • setOnDate

        public SiteData setOnDate​(int onDate)
        Turn on date. Date on which the station, or sensor indicated began operating. The columns offdate and ondate are not intended to accommodate temporary downtimes, but rather to indicate the time period for which the columns of the station (<I>lat</I>, <I>lon</I>, <I>elev</I>,) are valid for the given station code. Stations are often moved, but with the station code remaining unchanged.
        Parameters:
        onDate -
        Returns:
        reference to this

      • getOffDate

        public int getOffDate()
        Turn off date. This column is the Julian Date on which the station or sensor indicated was turned off, dismantled, or moved (see <I>ondate</I>)
        Returns:
        offdate

        Parameters:
        epochTime - The new epoch on time for this SiteData object.

      • getOffTime

        public double getOffTime()
        Returns the site epoch off time in seconds. Convert a jdate (int yyyyddd) into an epoch time (double seconds since 1970). Before returning it, 1 day minus 1 millisecond is added to the epoch time.
        Returns:
        The site epoch off time in seconds.

      • setOffTime

        public void setOffTime​(double epochTime)
        Sets this SiteData epoch off time (sec).
        Parameters:
        epochTime - The new epoch on time for this SiteData object.

        public boolean inRange​(int jdate)
        Returns true if the specified input epochTime is in range (>= onTime and < offTime) of this SiteData "on" range.
        Parameters:
        jdate - The input epoch time to be tested for in range with this SiteData "on" range.
